item.title: Digitalisation of the Ecuadorian System during Covid-19: an Exploratory Analysis of three Factors of Exclusion
item.description: The world is facing an unparalleled education crisis. At the time of writing, still over a billion learners in 143 countries area affected by school closures (UNESCO, 2020). In one of these countries, Ecuador, the government has responded by rapidly digitalising its education system. Despite these efforts, some columnists have publicly started to question the fairness of this approach (Constante, 2020). My brief analysis of household survey data collected in 2019 strengthens such worries.
